title-part.text: LABELLING OR TAGGING MACHINES, APPARATUS, OR PROCESSES

reference.text: nailing or stapling in general B25C, B27F; applying labels for packaging purposes B65B; labels, name-plates G09F
series-printing machines B41L; containers for the storage or transport of packages B65D

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass, the following term is used with the meaning indicated:"labels" covers also decalcomanias, stamps or the like
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Affixing labels to one flat surface of articles, e.g. of packages, of flat bands

CPC-specific-text.text: the label being applied by movement of the labelling head towards the article
and being supplied from a stack
the label being picked up by the article to be labelled, i.e. the labelling head remaining stationary
and the article being moved out of its normal conveyance path towards the labelling head
the labelling head and the article both being moved towards each other

title-part.text: Affixing labels, e.g. wrap-around labels, to two or more flat surfaces of a polyhedral article

CPC-specific-text.text: using two or more applicators, e.g. cooperating rollers or brushes
acting one after the other
by rotating the article about one of its axes

title-part.text: Affixing labels to elongated objects, e.g. wires, cables, bars, tubes
Applying bands or labels to cigars or cigarettes
